msContents.summary:
I) Dǝrsan maḥyawi “The Life-Giving Homily” (fols. 4ra-83rb l.7) I-1) Introductory prayer (fol. 4ra-va l.14) I-2) Reading for Monday, Compline (nǝwam) (fols. 4va l.17-16vb l.6) I-3) Reading for Tuesday, Matins (mänfäqä lelit) (fols. 16va l.9-26vb) I-4) Reading for Wednesday, Lauds (nägh) (fols. 27r l.14-36rb l.10) I-5) Reading for Thursday, Terce (śalastu säʿat) (fols. 36ra l.13-48r) I-6) Reading for Friday, Sext (qätr) (fols. 48v-62rb l.13) I-7) Reading for Saturday, None (täsaʿtu säʿat) (fols. 62ra l.16-72vb l.12) I-8) Reading for Sunday, Vespers (śärk) (fols. 72va l.15-79vb) I-9) Zenā säqoqawǝki... “The Story of Your lamentation...” (fols. 80ra-83rb)

msContents.colophon: f. 83r: ይትባረክ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ዘአፈጸመኒ፡ በደኅና፡ ወበሰላም፡ በ፲ወ፱፻፲ ወ፫፡ ኮነ፡ ዓመተ፡ ዓለም፡ ወለጸሐፊሁ፡ ኃጥእ፡ ወአባሲ፡ ኪዳነ፡ ማርያም።f. 83r: May God be blessed who caused me to complete (it) in health and in peace in 1913 year of the world. And his scribe sinner and trespasser Kidāna Māryām. According to the colophon the Ms. was completed in 1913 “year of the world” which most likely should be interpreted as the “year of mercy”. 1913 year of mercy corresponds to 1920/21 A.D. The scribe of the Ms. is Kidāna Māryām.

f. 83r: Purchase note. f. 83r: እኔ፡ ቄስ፡ ወልደ፡ ገብርኤል፡ ይህ፡ ድርሳነ፡ መድኃኔ፡ ዓለም፡ ስገዛ፡ ከአለቃ፡ ገብረ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ <...>፡ በ፳፫ ብር፡ ዳኛ፡ አባ፡ ወልደ፡ ገብርኤል፡ አማኞች፡ ኪዳነ፡ ገብረ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ አባ፡ መድኅን፡ አባ፡ ተክለ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ ቀቀማ
The note is written in Amharic, in pencil. It mentions the buyer, priest Walda Gäbrǝʾel, the seller ʾaläqa Gabra ʾƎgziʾabǝḥer, three witnesses and the amount of 23 Bǝrr which was paid for the Ms. called here Dǝrsāna Madḫāne ʿĀlam “Homily on the Saviour of the World”. Also, Qäqäma is mentioned as the location of the transaction.

- Omitted words and letters are written interlineally: e.g., fols. 7vb, 13ra, 19ra, 37rb. - Erasures are marked with three parallel lines: e.g., fols. 13rb, 37ra, 37rb, 47ra, 49rab, 67va, 75rb. - Minor notes, writing exercises and doodles: fols. 1r, 83v.

person.persName: According to Additio 1, the owners are ʾabuna Walda Madḫǝn, Ṣǝge ʾAragāwi, Gabra Māryām, ʾAmata Māryām and others. Their names are written (in strong amaranth) in the supplication formulas throughout the text: ʾabuna Walda Madḫǝn (e.g., fols. 4va, 8vb, 11ra, 14ra, 15ra, 18vb, 20rb, 23ra, 25va, 36rb, 55vb, 60vb, 70ra, 83rb), ʾAmata Māryām (e.g., fols. 6vb, 13vb, 15ra, 19vb, 23ra, 25va, 32rb, 45ra, 60vb, 83rb), ʾAmata Gäbrǝʾel (fols. 19rb, 21va), Ṣǝge ʾAragāwi (e.g., 21va, 26vb, 42vb, 54va, 65va, 77vb), Walatta Māryām (fols. 25va, 40va), Walatta Gäbrǝʾel (fol. 25va), Gabra Ḥǝywät (fols. 31vb, 41rb, 47ra, 50va, 55vb), Gabra Māryām (e.g., fols. 45ra, 48rb, 54rb, 71ra). The ownership note and the names in the supplication formulas are written in the same crude secondary hand. The purchase note (Additio 2) mentiones priest Walda Gäbrǝʾel as the buyer and and ʾaläqa Gabra ʾƎgziʾabǝḥer as the seller.
